Welcome to this mandala coloring book! Created using the open-source programming language R, this book is completely [free](https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/free-sw.html)! And here's the best part: if you're craving even more mandalas, just come back tomorrow. This book refreshes itself every day, offering you 32 brand-new mandalas to enjoy.

```{r echo = FALSE}
if (!knitr::is_html_output()) {
  for (i in seq_len(10)) {
    seed <- sample.int(.Machine$integer.max, 1)
    set.seed(seed)
    p1 <- generate_mandala()
    set.seed(seed)
    p2 <- generate_mandala(colors = TRUE)
    gridExtra::grid.arrange(p2, p1, layout_matrix = matrix(c(
      2, 2, 2, 2, NA,
      2, 2, 2, 2, NA,
      2, 2, 2, 2, NA,
      2, 2, 2, 1, 1,
      NA, NA, NA, 1, 1
    ), byrow = TRUE, nrow = 5, ncol = 5))
  }
}
```
